Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface.debug

Interface DebugPainterOverlay3D

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimDebugPainterOverlay3D
public interface DebugPainterOverlay3D

A DebugPainterOverlay3D allows a developer to draw output on a 3D map at runtime. Such a map may be the simulated environment map on the simulator. The entire drawing is organized by 'commands'. This means, the drawing output does not immediatly appear on screen, but is memorized whenever the screen is refreshed. Everything what is planned to draw is 'added' to all further drawing commands. To start with an empty set of drawing, the developer has to call clear(). After all drawing commands are entered, paint() transmit the output to screen. All coordinates are cm x,y,z.

Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Method Details

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clear debug output.

    • paint

      void paint()
      Submit the output to screen.

    • drawDot

      void drawDot​(double cmX, double cmY, double cmZ, int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Draw a dot.
      Parameters:
      cmX - position x in world coordinates
      cmY - position y in world coordinates
      cmZ - position z (height) in world coordinates
      red - color red value
      green - color green value
      blue - color blue value
      alpha - color alpha value

    • drawLine

      void drawLine​(double cmX1, double cmY1, double cmZ1, double cmX2, double cmY2, double cmZ2, int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Draw a line.
      Parameters:
      cmX1 - line start position x in world coordinates
      cmY1 - line start position y in world coordinates
      cmZ1 - line start position z (height) in world coordinates
      cmX2 - line end position x in world coordinates
      cmY2 - line end position y in world coordinates
      cmZ2 - line end position z (height) in world coordinates
      red - color red value
      green - color green value
      blue - color blue value
      alpha - color alpha value

    • drawArrow

      void drawArrow​(double cmX1, double cmY1, double cmZ1, double cmX2, double cmY2, double cmZ2, double headLen, double headAng, int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Draw an arrow.
      Parameters:
      cmX1 - line start position x in world coordinates
      cmY1 - line start position y in world coordinates
      cmZ1 - line start position z (height) in world coordinates
      cmX2 - line end position x in world coordinates
      cmY2 - line end position y in world coordinates
      cmZ2 - line end position z (height) in world coordinates
      headLen - length of arrow head
      headAng - opening angle of arrow head (in radians)
      red - color red value
      green - color green value
      blue - color blue value
      alpha - color alpha value

    • drawChar

      void drawChar​(char c, double cmX, double cmY, double cmZ, double size, double[][] rot, int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Draw a letter with lines. Note that only some letter can be drawn.
      Parameters:
      c - letter
      cmX - line start position x in world coordinates
      cmY - line start position y in world coordinates
      cmZ - line start position z (height) in world coordinates
      size - letter size in cm
      rot - rotate the letter in 3D, if null-rotation, the letter is drawn in the x-y-plane
      red - color red value
      green - color green value
      blue - color blue value
      alpha - color alpha value

    • drawXYZAxis

      void drawXYZAxis​(double offsetX, double offsetY, double offsetZ, double rotXY, double size)
      Draw the three axes arrows and 'x', 'y', 'z'.
      Parameters:
      offsetX - world coordinates of 0-point x (in cm)
      offsetY - world coordinates of 0-point y (in cm)
      offsetZ - world coordinates of 0-point z (in cm)
      rotXY - rotation in the x-y-plane (radians, positive goes counter-clockwise); z axis always points to 'sky'
      size - size of an axis (in cm)

    • drawXYZAxis

      void drawXYZAxis​(RotoTranslation rt, double size, int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Draw the three axes arrows and 'x', 'y', 'z'.
      Parameters:
      rt - roto-translation of axis.
      size - size of an axis (in cm)
      red - color red value
      green - color green value
      blue - color blue value
      alpha - color alpha value
